page.title: 09TRADING POTT SHRIGLEY.
page.content: Livestock at "Homestead Farm" are fed in the natural way without additives or growth-promoting hormones mixed with their food & little artificial fertiliser used on the land.The goats are kept for their milk & meat. Milk is sold through carefully selected health-food shops in the neighbourhood The farm shop offers kidmeat and a variety of goat cheeses, many made with herbs,fruits or liqueurs. These cheeses have won many prizes at recent Cheshire Shows. Kids are also sold for breeding and the Angora goat bears a valuable fleece. Wool from the sheep goes to the Wool Board and fleeces are sold at the farm. Tamworth pig meat has a unique flavour and goes into the very popular herb-sausages and bacon and hams, which are sweet cured or smoked over apple wood rubbed with honey and molasses.
